alert.note: Alert for Bledsoe; Rhea; Sequatchie (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 31 at 8:38PM CDT until August 01 at 12:30AM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM CDT/1245 AM EDT/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Bledsoe, Rhea and Sequatchie. * WHEN...Until 1145 PM CDT /1245 AM EDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 838 PM CDT /938 PM EDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dayton, Pikeville, Graysville, Brayton, Palio, Old Cumberland, Sale Creek and Cagle. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
